member.name: M:ECommerceApp.Api.Pipeline.JwtAuthorizeAttribute.OnAuthorization(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Filters.AuthorizationFilterContext)
member.summary:
Authorization is performed by the OnAuthorization method which checks if there is an authenticated user attached to the current request (context.HttpContext.Items["UserId"]). An authenticated user is attached by the custom jwt middleware if the request contains a valid JWT access token.
On successful authorization no action is taken and the request is passed through to the controller action method, if authorization fails a 401 Unauthorized response is returned.

member.name: T:ECommerceApp.Api.Pipeline.JwtMiddleware
member.summary:
The custom JWT middleware checks if there is a token in the request Authorization header, and if so attempts to:
Validate the token
Extract the user id from the token
Attach the authenticated user to the current HttpContext.Items collection to make it accessible within the scope of the current request
If no valid JWT token is provided, then no user will be attached to the context.
